gov.nih.nlm.meme.common
Interface Authenticator

All Known Implementing Classes:
PasswordAuthenticator
public interface Authenticator

Generically represents a way to obtain authentication information. An application will request that an Authentication object provide its authentication information to an Authenticator. These two classes must be written together with knowledge of how the other one works. A sample exchange would work like this, 

 Authenticator authenticator = ;
 Authentication authentication = ;

 // pass info
 authentication.provideAuthentication(authenticator);

 // check and see if it was successful,
 if (authentication.failed()) {
   System.out.println("Authentication failed: " + authenticator.getReasonFailed();
 }

Author:
MEME Group
See Also:
Authentication

Method Summary
 void authenticationFailed(String reason)

 boolean failed()
          Indicates whether authentication failed or passed.

          Returns the reason for authentication failure.
 

Method Detail

authenticationFailed

public void authenticationFailed(String reason)
Informs Authenticator that authentication has failed. It indicates that it could not provide the necessary authentication information.

Parameters:
reason - the reason for authentication failure.

getReasonFailed

public String getReasonFailed()
Returns the reason for authentication failure.

Returns:
the reason for authentication failure

failed

public boolean failed()
Indicates whether authentication failed or passed.

Returns:
true if authentication failed; false otherwise.
